https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: Images scaled by the browser
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: Never scale images in the browser, that will slow down the rendering.

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: Cache Time
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: How long time the assets are cached in the browser. Long time is good.

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: Critical Rendering Path Score
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: Do as little as possible within the HEAD tag so that the browser can start rendering a page as soon as possible (avoid DNS lookups and load CSS/JS files).

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: Number of CSS images per page
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: Few larger CSS images are better when using HTTP 1.1. For HTTP 2.0 it is better with many small files from few domains.

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: Number of CSS files per page
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: Few larger files are better when using HTTP 1.1. For HTTP 2.0 it is better with many small files from few domains.

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: CSS Weight
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: The weight of CSS is important, because of mobile and networks, keep the size to a minimal.

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: CSS File Weight Per Page
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: Do not download large front-end CSS framework when you only use small parts of it.

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: Document Weight
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: Keep the document at a reasonable size, it will make it possible for the browser to generate the page faster.

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: Number of DOM elements
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: Too many DOM elements means that the page is complex and will be slower to render

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: Number of font files per page
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: Few larger files are better when using HTTP 1.1. For HTTP 2.0 it is better with many small files from few domains.

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: Number of images per page
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: Avoid too many images because it will take time for them all to load.

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: Image Weight
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: The weight of images is important, are usually 60-70% of the total page weight

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: Images Weight Per Page
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: Image weight are the largest part of a web page. Make sure they are compressed and as small as possible.

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: Number of JS files per page
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: Few larger files are better when using HTTP 1.1. For HTTP 2.0 it is better with many small files from few domains.

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: Number of JS synchronously inside head
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: Loading Javascript synchronously inside of the HEAD tag will slow down your page rendering. Just don't do it!

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: JS Weight
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: The weight of javascripts is important, because of mobile and networks, keep the size to a minimal.

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: JS File Weight Per Page
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: Don't download large Javascript libraries when you only use small parts of it.

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: Max requests per domain
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: Using HTTP 1.1 you want to avoid loading too many assets from one domain

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: Remove duplicate JS and CSS
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: It is bad practice include the same js or css twice since browsers will execute the code each time

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: Number Of Domains
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: Many domains means many DNS lookups and that means slower pages.

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: Total page weight (including all assets)
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: The total size is really important because of slow mobile networks, keep the size small.

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: Pages with SPOF
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: How many pages have a single point of failures (meaning if someone else's API/site is broken, it will break your page.

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: Redirects Per Page
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: Avoid doing redirects, it will slow down the page!

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: Number of requests per page
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: Fewer requests are always faster than many requests.

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: Requests Without Expires
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: Requests shall always have expire headers, so that they can be cached by the browser

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: Requests without GZip
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: All text content (JS/CSS/HTML) can and should be sent GZiped so that the size is as small as possible.

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: Rule Score
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: The sitespeed.io total rule score for all the pages

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: Domains with only one request
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: Many domains means many DNS lookups and that means slower pages. Only loading one request for one domain is wasteful.

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: Number of SPOF per page
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: A Single Point Of Failure is a asset that is loaded (usually) from another domain before the page starts rendering, meaning if the asset isn not loaded, the page will be broken/slow.

https://www.casual-fashion.com.title: Time since last modification
https://www.casual-fashion.com.desc: The time since a file was changed the last time. If it was long ago, please make sure the cache time is high!
